message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product, and I think it's a great opportunity for you to make a smart investment. I'm willing to sell it to you for $11,500. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, Alice, but I'm looking to pay a bit less.  How about $10,500?  I think that's a fair price considering the value we're both seeing in this product.
I understand you're looking to pay a bit less, Bob, but I still need to make a profit on this deal. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, so I'm counteroffering $11,000. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit too high for my budget. How about $10,750? This would be a fair price for both of us, allowing you to make a profit while I get a good deal.

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob, but I'm still not quite there. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering $11,250. This is as low as I can go without losing money on the deal. What do you think?

Alice, I understand you need to make a profit, but $11,250 is still too high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $10,900. This is a fair compromise, and it would allow us to both walk away happy.  What do you say?

I'm not willing to go any lower than $11,250, Bob. However, I'm willing to throw in some additional value to sweeten the deal. I'll include a 1-year warranty and priority customer support. I think this is a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality product with added peace of mind. I'm still selling it to you for $11,250.
